subject: Marketing
title: Marketing to Children
description: A micro-lesson that makes Marketing to Children usable.

hook.text: Children under 8 cannot distinguish ads from content. They believe everything they see.

buildup.text: Cereal brands place mascots at child eye-level and use bright colors to attract kids.

discovery.text: The inability to recognize persuasion intent makes children uniquely vulnerable to marketing.

twist.text: Sweden and Norway ban advertising to children under 12. Most countries have no such laws.

climax.text: Marketing to those who can't critically evaluate it raises the deepest ethical questions.

punchline.text: Persuading those who can't resist isn't persuasion. It's exploitation.

quiz.question: Why is marketing to young children considered ethically problematic?
options: Children under 8 cannot distinguish ads from content
Children have too much spending power
Parents always approve of ads targeting their children
